comment.body: After rebooting my Mac, the above “[Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/195865#issuecomment-2620511584)” is now happening in response to these 2 filters only when the add-on is enabled.  For some reason, it was happening for a while before when it was either on or off.  Either way, these shouldn’t be blocking legitimate related item links from loading on any site when clicked.  And it was only in recent months when it started happening, which is why I had to disable AG on Amazon.

issue.title: Fix #197510 aftermath.site

comment.body: If you check both https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/197510 and https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/196987, you will see that I made a pull request before they even assigned themselves, let alone created a rule. Yet both times, my pull request was ignored. I am always happy to improve my rules if there is a problem; however, I can't do that if they won't tell me what the problem is.

issue.title: Fix #197510 aftermath.site

comment.body:
> It's already on the filter list.

I have left it open while I wait for @Sergey-Lyapin to inform me why they did not like my rule. However, they then went ahead and created a new rule that vary closely resembles this one. This is now the second time they have done this.
